tool.name: DropletUtils Read10x
tool.command:
ln -s '${matrix}' matrix.mtx && ln -s '${genes}' genes.tsv && ln -s '${barcodes}' barcodes.tsv && dropletutils-read-10x-counts.R -s . -c TRUE -o '${output_rds}'
#if $add_metadata.add_metadata_file --metadata-files "${add_metadata.metadata_files}" --cell-id-column "${add_metadata.cell_id_column}" #end if

param.name: matrix
param.label: Expression matrix in sparse matrix format (.mtx)

param.name: metadata_files
param.label: Metadata file
param.help: Provide metadata file e.g. containing cell types

param.name: cell_id_column
param.label: Cell ID column
param.help: Cell ID column. Values must match those provided in the expression matrix.

tool.help:
============================================================= Read 10x-Genomics-formatted mtx directory (`Read10xCounts()`) =============================================================
The mtx directory should contain:
1) Raw expression quantification as a sparse matrix in Matrix Market format, where the each column is a gene and each row is a barcode/cell.
2) A gene table of at least two columns where the first column gives the gene IDs.
3) A barcode/cell table of at least one column giving the barcode/cell IDs.
The above-mentioned files can be obtained by running `EBI SCXA Data Retrieval` with a dataset accession.
@HELP@
